segments.text: I think the woman is in her own little world, completely ignoring the mess around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and she’s just polishing that plate like it’s the most important thing ever.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how focused she is on something so trivial while her kitchen is flooding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and she doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just pretending not to see or if she’s really that unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to fall off that stool, and she’s just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a train wreck in slow motion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge, and she’s acting like it’s not even happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I don’t know how she can be so calm while everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is so bizarre and unsettling.
segments.speaker: PAR
